attributes.action: allow UK citizens who are currently unpaid overseas charity workers to access the NHS (particularly those working in developing countries)
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Under current legislation UK citizens who are unpaid charity workers for more than 5 years ARE NO LONGER ENTITLED TO FREE NHS HEALTH CARE until they return PERMANENTLY to the UK because access to the NHS is based on RESIDENCE only - not citizenship or National Insurance contributions;

-unless they work in a country with a health agreement with the UK (No countries in developing countries are included in this)

OVERSEAS CHARITY WORKERS FOR MORE THAN 5 YEARS are treated as visitors to the UK and MUST PAY FOR THEIR TREATMENT.

Access to the NHS is based solely on RESIDENCE.

Information can be found here: 

http://www.dh.gov.uk/PolicyAndGuidance/International/OverseasVisitors/fs/en
